title: If we move backwards in time, when will the spoken English cease to be intelligible, 3rd century or 4th century? - Quora

response.answer_text: Third or fourth century? More like 14th or 15th century. The later stages of middle English might be partially intelligible to some contemporary English speakers, especially those who are familiar with different British dialects. For real general intelligibility though, you probably couldn’t go back earlier than the 16th or 17th centuries.
